result.execSummary:
The defendant Rick C Crain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Rick C Crain

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with prison sentence now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.   If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with the victim.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Attend and successfully complete anger management counseling, if agent recommends.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: same as prison sentence.

ADDRESS INFO for Rick C Crain
Current: PO Box 233, C/O Jackson Correctional Institutuion, Black River Falls, WI 54615   (Effective: 03-23-2016)
Prior: N6500 Haipek Road, C/O Jackson Correctional Institutuion, Black River Falls, WI 54615
Offender Conduct Record
of Arraignment Plea/Sentencing Hearing held 08/08/2016
Written explanation of determinate sentence
from DOC.  Sent to Judge Becker electronically. JMM

Amended Information will be filed.   Amend Count 1, no repeater, but as PTC.  Victim notification complied with.  Plead no contest to the charge.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.   Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Battery by Prisoner, contrary to 940.20(1) and 939.05.  Joint recommendation for:  6 years total.  18 months initial confinement and 4 1/2 years extended supervision.  Concurrent with current prison sentence.  No contact with the victim.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Anger management counseling, if agent recommends.  CC.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  

Court ordered:  6 years total.  18 months initial confinement and 4 -1/2 years extended supervision.  Concurrent with current prison sentence now serving.  No contact with the victim.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Anger management counseling, if agent recommends.  CC.  Not eligible for CIP and SAP.
Waive reading of the information.
information filed with the court.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Bosben.   Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Bosben.  Set for plea/sentencing and ARGN.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: with victim, J.M.D.

(sent copies to DA and JASO)

Pre-trial conference on June 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on July 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears by video from Jackson Correctional Institution.  His counsel, Gina Bosben appears by phone.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: with victim, J.M.D.

Defendant appears by video from Jackson Correctional Institution.  His counsel, Gina Bosben appears by phone.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Bosben waives the reading of the complaint and her client stands mute; waives the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  He admits to receipt of complaint and understands charge/penalties.  Court reviews the right to a preliminary hearing within the time limits with the defendant.  Court accepts his waiver to have preliminary hearing within the time limits.  Pre-trial 6-22 at 10:00 and a status on 7-11 at 3:00.  Attorney Bosben may appear by phone and the defendant does not need to appear.  Bond ordered as requested by the State.
from Attorney Bosben
Adjourned initial appearance on June 7, 2016 at 09:15 am.
